ids_info.name: pf_passive
ids_info.description: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description

pf_passive/loop.documentation: Passive axisymmetric conductor description in the form of non-connected loops; any connected loops are expressed as active coil circuits with no power supply attached. Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description.

pf_passive/loop/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device). Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description. Within loop container: Passive axisymmetric conductor description in the form of non-connected loops; any connected loops are expressed as active coil circuits with no power supply attached.

pf_passive/loop/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “channel viewing the upper divertor”. Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description. Within loop container: Passive axisymmetric conductor description in the form of non-connected loops; any connected loops are expressed as active coil circuits with no power supply attached.

Within loop container: Passive axisymmetric conductor description in the form of non-connected loops; any connected loops are expressed as active coil circuits with no power supply attached.

pf_passive/loop/element.documentation: Each loop is comprised of a number of cross-section elements described  individually. Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description. Within loop container: Passive axisymmetric conductor description in the form of non-connected loops; any connected loops are expressed as active coil circuits with no power supply attached.

pf_passive/loop/element/turns_with_sign.documentation: Number of effective turns in the element for calculating the magnetic field from the coil/loop. Should be positive, unless the coil has elements going in opposite directions. Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description. Within element container: Each loop is comprised of a number of cross-section elements described  individually.

Within element container: Each loop is comprised of a number of cross-section elements described  individually. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element.

Length of the parallelogram side inclined with angle alpha with respect to the major radius axis. Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Length of the parallelogram side inclined with angle beta with respect to the height axis. Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description. Within element container: Each loop is comprised of a number of cross-section elements described  individually. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within oblique container: Parallelogram description of the element.

Inclination of first angle measured counter-clockwise from horizontal outwardly directed radial vector (grad R). Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description. Within loop container: Passive axisymmetric conductor description in the form of non-connected loops; any connected loops are expressed as active coil circuits with no power supply attached. Within element container: Each loop is comprised of a number of cross-section elements described  individually. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within oblique container: Parallelogram description of the element.

Inclination of second angle measured counter-clockwise from vertically upwards directed vector (grad Z). If both alpha and beta are zero (rectangle) then the simpler rectangular elements description should be used. Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description. Within element container: Each loop is comprised of a number of cross-section elements described  individually. Within geometry container: Cross-sectional shape of the element. Within oblique container: Parallelogram description of the element.

pf_passive/loop/element/geometry/arcs_of.documentation: Description of the element contour by a set of arcs of circle. For each of these, the position of the start point is given together with the curvature radius. The end point is given by the start point of the next arc of circle. Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description. Within arcs_of_circle container: Description of the element contour by a set of arcs of circle. For each of these, the position of the start point is given together with the curvature radius. The end point is given by the start point of the next arc of circle.

Within loop container: Passive axisymmetric conductor description in the form of non-connected loops; any connected loops are expressed as active coil circuits with no power supply attached.

pf_passive/time.documentation: Generic time. Within pf_passive IDS: Description of the axisymmetric passive conductors, currents flowing in them. Electromagnetic simulations are expected to use only this IDS to describe passive conductors and their specific discretization, not the component-related IDS (e.g. wall) which are used to store e.g. the component machine description.
